review.body: Thanks for this enhancement to the current logic, @pi-314159 ! LGTM. If you already built this and ran `testrun.sh` successfully against this (?) I'd say let's deploy this.

pull_request.title: Call Keccak_(X4_)Dispatch with pthread_once
pull_request.body:
Fixes #1548.

Call Keccak_(X4_)Dispatch using pthread_once to ensure setting of global function pointers is atomic and done only once.

* [x] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  NO
* [x] Does this PR change the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming? Does this PR otherwise change an API? NO

repo.name: liboqs
repo.description: C library for prototyping and experimenting with quantum-resistant cryptography

review.body:
Code LGTM. The only slight concern I have is that this seems to add pthreads as a requirement to `liboqs` (and hence, its users). Have you tested that this new code works OK if used by a downstream project, @zxjtan ? 

Thinking that through, what about adding CI to `liboqs` automatically validating this property with downstream projects we consider essential, @dstebila ? Or would this create a hen-and-egg situation where downstream projects' status (of not being ready for an `liboqs` update) can break `liboqs` CI and hence stop the whole procedure? Let me create a separate discussion for this...

pull_request.title: Run copy_from_upstream and test
pull_request.body:
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->
Fixes #1586

* [no] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [no] Does this PR change the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming? Does this PR otherwise change an API? (If so, PRs in fully supported downstream projects dependent on these, i.e., [oqs-provider](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider) and [OQS-OpenSSH](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh) will also need to be ready for review and merge by the time this is merged.)
